The equity strategy, emphasizing the most disadvantaged and excluded children and families, translates this commitment to children‚Äôs rights into action. For UNICEF, equity means that all children have an opportunity to survive, develop and reach their full potential, without discrimination, bias or favoritism. To the degree that any child has an unequal chance in life ‚Äî in its social, political, economic, civic and cultural dimensions ‚Äî her or his rights are violated. There is growing evidence that investing in the health, education and protection of a society‚Äôs most disadvantaged citizens ‚Äî addressing inequity ‚Äî not only will give more children the opportunity to fulfill their potential but also will lead to sustained growth and stability of countries. This is why the focus on equity is so vital.
